comments:
Hello Colleagues,

I came upon issue causing a NullPointerException in the WS Client wizard. This exception happens even before the first page of the wizard is displayed. I was able to track down the issue to a somehow corrupted workspace. Still, no manuaul modifications or whatever have been applied to my workspace. I'm attaching my workspace with the help of which the error can be reproduced.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Make your eclipse ide use the attached workspace.
2. The ide will have a single oppened project called "fdfd"
3. There's a WSDL file in this project. Select it and from the context menu choose to create a web service client
4. A NullPointerException will occur.

Regards,
Hristo
*** Bug 176823 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Hi Colleagues,

As the zip is > 3MB I'm pasting the link where it can be downloaded:

http://debian.fmi.uni-sofia.bg/~zeppelin/wrkspc_mk.zip

Regards,
Hristo
Hristo, can you attach the complete stack trace?

Hi Chris,

Please find bellow the full stack trace.

Regards,
Hristo

I haven't looked at this too carefully, but based on the stack trace it looks like this may be another symptom of 159458.  I hope that the patch on that bug would fix this problem.

Yes.  The symptom and stack trace looks similar to what was fixed in bug 159458.  Since bug 159458 has been released to WTP 1.5.4 back in April 2007.  Please retry your scenario with WTP 1.5.4 or with the latest WTP 1.5.5 or WTP 2.0.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 159458 ***

If these defects are still left in the Resolve state in a couple of weeks, we might verify and close these defects on behalf of the originator.  But since you know the original problem best, it would be best if you could take a moment to verify these defects in the latest available drivers.  Thanks!

This defect has been in RESOLVE state for some time.  Please verify it with the latest driver.  WTP 2.0.1 RC1 is available at:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R2.0/M-2.0.1RC1-20070907070540/
